feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Integration Suite
feed.subtitle: SAP Integration Suite Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Manage FILE and Folders
entry.content:
I created a service request for the configuration of folder access to my SAP/HANA development system (Manage OS Files & Folders ). However, I cannot find where to specify that this is on a CIFS (SAMBA) share previously mounted in my environment.

The file server has already been configured; I only need the mappings in order to access my file system through AL11 or the FILE transaction.

entry.title: Evaluating Risks of Non-VPN Access to SAP BTP Cockpit
entry.content:
Hello,

Is it standard practice for users to access the SAP BTP Cockpit using only company-issued S-user credentials—without requiring VPN or corporate network access? While this setup does offer convenience, it also raises potential security concerns. For instance, logging in from a personal device over the public internet, without any corporate network safeguards, could expose sensitive assets.
Would appreciate your thoughts on this. Thanks in advance.

Thanks

entry.title: A detailed step by step process to connect the ArcGIS to SAP Datasphere for data federation
entry.content: We are planning to connect the Arc GIS system to SAP Datasphere for information extraction or accessibility. There is not standard document exists. Request to provide a detailed information and process to establish the connection.

entry.title: SAP CPI suppressing root and row elements in XML to JSON conversion
entry.content:
Hi, 

I have an XML message like below

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<root>
<row>
<private_agency_code>0000110033</private_agency_code>
<branch_code>2100</branch_code>
</row>
<row>
<private_agency_code>0000110035</private_agency_code>
<branch_code>2300</branch_code>
</row>
</root>

I need JSON in the format below

[
{
"private_agency_code": "0000110033",
"branch_code": "2100"  },
{
"private_agency_code": "0000110035",
"branch_code": "2300"  }
]

Even if i am suppressing root in the XML to JSON, row element is still coming in the JSON.

How to achieve the desired payload.

Thanks

entry.title: Not able to post data to OData V4 API in S4
entry.content:
We are not able to post data to OData V4 API in S4. We are using Post Query from the query builder and mapped our data to the xsd structure we got. However we are getting error as "XML is malformed".

We have already applied note https://me.sap.com/notes/0003266527 , but still no luck. 

Can someone please guide. 

Thanks

entry.title: What is the order in which the status is sorted while using Status,LogEnd desc filter
entry.content:
I am retrieving the status of the MPL through the API. I want to check if a particluar iflow is completed.

We have been using the following query :

/api/v1/MessageProcessingLogs?$filter=IntegrationFlowName%20eq%20%27IFLOWNAME%27%20and%20LogStart%20gt%20datetime%272025-09-01T11:59:31.658%27&$top=1

This sometimes do not retrieve the 'Completed' status at all.

So I have added order by LogEnd desc. This was going smooth until at for an iflow the Completed timestamp is 5:44:07 and DISCARDED timestamp is 5:44:10, my code kept picking the DISCARDED status and there was no way it is going to retrieve the details of the COMPLETED logs.

On further analysis I found there is this filter option to orderBy: Status,LogEnd desc

I want to know how this filter works, which status gets the precedence in this filter. 

If I have Completed and Abandoned status , and Abandoned is the latest which one will be retrieved as Top 1 while using this?

Thanks,

entry.title: Integration Suite SFTP connection "Too many authentication failures"
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

i am trying to set up an SFTP connection in my Integration Suite. When doing an connectivity test i get the error

"com.jcraft.jsch.JSchSessionDisconnectException: SSH_MSG_DISCONNECT: 2 Too many authentication failures".

I am connecting to an OpenSSH Server wich is exposed in my CloudConnector via Port 22. As authentication i am using user credentials. The user is not disabled on the Windows Server.

entry.title: Integration Suite: Header not recognized in SFTP Receiver as FileName
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

 

in my iFlow i am trying to send an header to my SFTP Receiver adapter to set the name of the written file. Unfortunately the header wont get recognized and the filename seems to be genereated randomly. I already worked with dynamic headers in different iFlows. So I dont know why its not working.

iFlow SFTP receiver adapter

 

Sending the request via Postman

File that gets generated

Greetings

Rouven

entry.title: SAP Microsoft SharePoint Sender Adapter: itemNotFound Error While Accessing Files
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am working on a scenario in SAP CI where I need to download a file from SharePoint via the Microsoft SharePoint Adapter.

The file exists in the following location:

https://xxx.sharepoint.com/sites/ClaimsDocuments/SiteCollectionDocuments/Design/test.pdf
 
From Microsoft Graph API, I can confirm that the drive and file details are valid (using /sites/{site-id}/drives and /drives/{drive-id}/root:/Design/test.pdf:/content).

In Postman, the file download works fine.

But in CPI, when I configure the Sender adapter as:

  • Site Host Name: xxx.sharepoint.com

  • Server Relative Path: /sites/ClaimsDocuments

  • Directory: /SiteCollectionDocuments/Design

  • File Name: test.pdf

I always get the following error:

com.sap.adapters.factory.sharepoint.exception.SharePointException: {"error":{"code":"itemNotFound","message":"The resource could not be found."}}
 
My Questions:

  1. In CPI SharePoint Adapter, how do we correctly point to Site Collection Documents (especially since the name has spaces)?

  2. Do we need to use the drive ID instead of the library name when the document library name includes spaces?

  3. Has anyone successfully used CPI SharePoint Adapter to read/write files in SiteCollectionDocuments or similar libraries?

Thanks.

entry.title: CPI mapping: values suppressed in final output
entry.content:
Hi, I'm having this issue in CPI mapping where the values in final output are being suppressed from the results of if condition, not sure if I'm missing something as I'm just directly mapping it to the final field from if.

Has anyone encountered this? Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Parallel Multicast causing random failures in my Message Mapping subprocesses
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I’m working on a very large integration that takes a long time to execute since it has many subprocesses running sequentially with a Sequential Multicast, each performing upserts to SuccessFactors.

To improve performance, I moved some of these subprocesses to a Parallel Multicast so they could run at the same time. This successfully cut the execution time in half, but now I’m occasionally running into random errors in the Message Mappings that don’t seem to make sense.

Some of the errors I’ve seen include:
com.sap.xi.mapping.camel.XiMappingException: A pseudo attribute name is expected.
com.sap.xi.mapping.camel.XiMappingException: Content is not allowed in prolog.
com.sap.xi.mapping.camel.XiMappingException: Premature end of file. (this one happens most often)

The subprocesses are running in parallel like this:



And the ones that tend to fail are the ones that include routers, like this one:



I’ve tried running them in Trace mode and reusing the failing payload in the Message Mapping simulation, and it works fine there. I also re-executed the integration with the exact same data, and it succeeded the second time. It looks like the payload is sometimes breaking randomly, which causes the mapping to fail.

Has anyone run into something similar? Any help would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks,
Agustin

entry.title: CPI Mapping: IF condition results not passing all the expected output
entry.content:
Hi, The expected output should be the one being map to the target field - PARTN_NUMB however only the first value is being passed on. Why is that? How can I achieve to pass all the expected output, I think I'm missing something.

 Appreciate your inputs! Thank you in advance~

entry.title: screenshot
SAP Integration Suite enhancements and governance
SKAT Integration via SOAP adapter in SAP CPI
entry.content:
We are trying to do SKAT integration via SOAP adapter and it seems SOAP adapter is not supporting the SKAT expectations.

Seems SOAP adapter doesnt support the following way of policies , Please help by confirming does the SOAP adapter in SAP CPI supports the following way of policies ? PDF link Guide til krypteret tilslutning  if you have already have some experience around this. and if there are any work arounds for this, please suggest.

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<wsp:Policy 
xmlns:sp="http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-securitypolicy/200702"
xmlns:wsp="http://www.w3.org/ns/ws-policy"
xmlns:wsu="http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss wssecurity-utility-1.0.xsd"
wsu:Id="skat-b2b-x509-policy">
 <wsp:ExactlyOne>
 <wsp:All>
 <sp:AsymmetricBinding>
 <wsp:Policy>
 <sp:InitiatorToken>
 <wsp:Policy>
 <sp:X509Token sp:IncludeToken="http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws sx/ws-securitypolicy/200702/IncludeToken/AlwaysToRecipient">
 <wsp:Policy>
 <sp:WssX509V3Token10/>

 </wsp:Policy>
</sp:X509Token>
 </wsp:Policy>
 </sp:InitiatorToken>
 <sp:RecipientToken>
 <wsp:Policy>
 <sp:X509Token sp:IncludeToken="http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws sx/ws-securitypolicy/200702/IncludeToken/Never">
 <wsp:Policy>
<sp:RequireThumbprintReference />
 <sp:WssX509V3Token10/>
 </wsp:Policy>
 </sp:X509Token>
 </wsp:Policy>
 </sp:RecipientToken>
 <sp:AlgorithmSuite>
 <wsp:Policy>
 <sp:TripleDes/>
 </wsp:Policy>
 </sp:AlgorithmSuite>
 <sp:Layout>
 <wsp:Policy>
 <sp:Lax/>
 </wsp:Policy>
 </sp:Layout>
 <sp:IncludeTimestamp/> 
 <sp:OnlySignEntireHeadersAndBody/>
 <sp:SignBeforeEncrypting/>
 </wsp:Policy>
 </sp:AsymmetricBinding>
<sp:SignedParts>
 <sp:Body/>
 </sp:SignedParts>
 <sp:EncryptedParts>
 <sp:Body/>
 </sp:EncryptedParts> 
 </wsp:All>
 </wsp:ExactlyOne>
 </wsp:Policy>

entry.title: Subject: Inquiry Regarding X.509 SSL Client Certificate Renewal for SEEGENE CPI
entry.content:
Subject: Inquiry Regarding X.509 SSL Client Certificate Renewal for SEEGENE CPI

 

Dear SAP Support Team,

 

I hope you are doing well.

 

I am the person in charge of SEEGENE CPI. Recently, I received the following email regarding the renewal of the X.509 SSL client certificate:



SAP Integration SuiteSystem Number:
741850516
System ID:
CLOUD
System Name:
SEEGENE CPI
System Role:
Production
Subaccount ID:
4377ead7-a5c1-49af-bbce-4d351580e884
Subaccount Name:
SEEGENE CPI

 

Thank you very much for your support. I look forward to your reply.

entry.title: Problem with oData Batch Update of SalesOrderItem
entry.content:
Hi 

I have looked at the following article related to the update of SalesOrderItem
ETag Handling | SAP Help Portal

It says

"The Etag handling feature is implemented on the A_SalesOrder node with the LastChangeDateTime property. If you want to use ETag handling for other entities (for example, A_SalesOrderItem), proceed as follows:

  1. Perform a GET operation to retrieve the content for the LastChangeDateTime property.

  2. Create a $batch request containing one changeset.

  3. As first operation of the changeset, include a PATCH A_SalesOrder with the LastChangeDateTime property. Provide the LastChangeDateTime content also in the request header in the If-Match field.

  4. As second operation of the changeset, include the desired payload (for example, POST A_SalesOrderItem or PATCH A_SalesOrderItem) with the relevant data"

With this in information I created the following XML with a view to update a single line initially.

<batchParts>
  <batchChangeSet>
    <batchChangeSetPart>
      <method>PATCH</method>
      <headers>
        <headerName>If-Match</headerName>
        <headerValue>W/"datetimeoffset'2025-09-10T07%3A27%3A59.4526150Z'"</headerValue>
      </headers>
      <A_SalesOrder>
        <A_SalesOrderType>
          <LastChangeDateTime>2025-09-10T07:27:59.452</LastChangeDateTime>
        </A_SalesOrderType>
      </A_SalesOrder>
    </batchChangeSetPart>
    <batchChangeSetPart>
      <method>PATCH</method>
      <A_SalesOrderItem>
        <A_SalesOrderItemType>
          <SalesOrder>1017493</SalesOrder>
          <SalesOrderItem>10</SalesOrderItem>
          <RequestedQuantity>26.2</RequestedQuantity>
          <RequestedQuantityUnit>TO</RequestedQuantityUnit>
        </A_SalesOrderItemType>
      </A_SalesOrderItem>
    </batchChangeSetPart>
  </batchChangeSet>
</batchParts>

After executing this using the following odata

I get the following error 

com.sap.gateway.core.ip.component.odata.exception.OsciException: Cannot invoke "String.equalsIgnoreCase(String)" because the return value of "java.util.Map$Entry.getKey()" is null, cause: java.lang.NullPointerException: Cannot invoke "String.equalsIgnoreCase(String)" because the return value of "java.util.Map$Entry.getKey()" is null

 

Please can someone explain what the issue is with the

entry.title: Timer Integrations in CPI, having null/unix epoch time in
entry.content:
I have a timer based integration which runs only once daily,  I use exception subprocess and mail adapter to log errors, and for some reason my emails coming as makred as striked saying "This message expired on Wednesday, December 31, 1969 7:00 PM."

I tried to manually pass current date as headers using custom headers but it's still not taking the time,

Does anyone faced any similar situations??
